javadoc: Iterates over index field values within a specified range.

methods.javadoc: Construct an index field iterator starting with the minimum index value.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct an index field iterator starting with the minimum index value.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct an index field iterator.  The iterator is positioned at index 
 value identified by startValue.

params.name: minValue
params.comment: minimum index value.  Null corresponds to minimum indexed value.

params.name: maxValue
params.comment: maximum index value.  Null corresponds to maximum indexed value.

params.name: before
params.comment:
if true initial position is before minValue, else position
 is after maxValue.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct an index field iterator.  The iterator is positioned at index 
 value identified by startValue.

params.name: minValue
params.comment: minimum index value.  Null corresponds to minimum indexed value.

params.name: maxValue
params.comment: maximum index value.  Null corresponds to maximum indexed value.

params.name: before
params.comment:
if true initial position is before minValue, else position
 is after maxValue.

methods.name: delete
methods.comment:
Delete all primary records which have the current
 index value (lastKey).

name: IndexVarFieldIterator
comment: Iterates over index field values within a specified range.
